Title: D-Bus: Format string vulnerability
Synopsis:
A vulnerability has been found in D-Bus possibly resulting in a
    local Denial of Service.

Background.Text: D-Bus is a message bus system, a simple way for applications to talk to one another.

Description.Text:
It was discovered that D-Bus incorrectly handles certain format strings.

The impact of this new vulnerability is believed to not be exploitable if D-Bus is patched against CVE-2015-0245. The previous vulnerability (CVE-2015-0245) was addressed in GLSA-201503-02 referenced below.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could cause a Denial of Service condition or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Workaround.Text:
The vulnerable D-Bus interface is intended only for use by systemd running as root.

The administrator can install a policy which denies sending from org.freedesktop.systemd1.Activator‚Äù to D-Bus. This will prevent non-root attackers from reaching the interface in order to exercise this flaw.

P.Text: All D-Bus users should upgrade to the latest version:
